title: Tell me about a time you visited a bank.

korean: 작년에 전세대출 받으려고 은행 갔던 게 기억나요.
모바일로는 안 되고 직접 방문해야 한다고 해서.
점심시간 피해서 갔는데도 사람이 엄청 많더라고요.
번호표 뽑고 한 시간 가까이 기다렸어요.
기다리는 동안 휴대폰만 계속 보고 있었죠.
드디어 제 차례가 와서 상담창구로 갔는데.
필요한 서류를 하나 안 가져온 거예요.
직원분이 그거 없으면 대출 신청이 안 된다고 하시더라고요.
완전 허탈했지만 어쩔 수 없이 다음에 다시 오기로 했어요.
집에 갔다가 서류 챙겨서 다음 날 또 갔죠.
다행히 그때는 서류도 다 맞고 대출 승인도 잘 됐어요.
그때 은행 업무는 미리 체크리스트 확인이 중요하다는 걸 배웠어요.
english: I remember going to the bank last year to get a jeonse loan.
They said I couldn't do it on mobile and had to visit in person.
Even though I went avoiding lunch time, there were so many people.
I took a number and waited for almost an hour.
While waiting, I just kept looking at my phone.
Finally it was my turn and I went to the consultation desk.
But I didn't bring one of the required documents.
The staff said I couldn't apply for the loan without it.
I felt totally deflated, but I had no choice but to come back next time.
I went home, got the documents together, and went again the next day.
Fortunately, that time all the documents were right and the loan was approved.
That's when I learned that checking the checklist beforehand is important for banking, you know.
